title: Eby says extortion wave is 'terror attack in slow motion'
desc: B.C. Premier David Eby says a wave of extortion crime in the province is a "terror attack in slow motion."

title: Jide Sipe, Abiodun Coker of UBA, others emerge as ACAMB executives
desc: The election, held during the association’s Annual General Meeting in Lagos on Thursday, saw seasoned professionals from across the banking landscape elected to key positions.

title: MLS to cut a quarter of Spanish-language broadcast talent on Apple TV, according to sources
desc: The league will send about half its live games to be produced in London, as MLS 360’s Spanish edition will cease production

title: Everton scouts jet away to Europa League showdown ahead of deadline
desc: Everton are clearly planning something as they quickly approach the winter transfer deadline in the coming days.

title: The Auckland doctor who uprooted his family to work in Nepal
desc: Snake bites, leprosy, tuberculosis, malnutrition were all conditions quite unfamiliar to young Kiwi, Greg Judkins.

title: Anthony Joshua speaks for first time since Nigeria crash
desc: Anthony Joshua has spoken publicly for the first time since the December car crash in Nigeria that killed his two friends.

title: Bissau junta leader promotes himself to top rank
desc: General Horta N'Tam, leader of the Guinea-Bissau junta, has promoted himself to major general, the highest rank in the country's armed forces.

title: Cold Temps, Snow & No Race Heats: Here's the Clash Forecast, Format
desc: NASCAR's Clash will look at little different this year. Find out how the cold temps will impact racing at Bowman Gray.

title: This week 3 new albums fight for the No.1 spot on the Billboard charts
desc: This week on the Billboard 200 albums chart, three albums landed within striking distance of the number-one spot. And a cult favorite has hit the Hot 100 more than 30 years.

title: Tim Cindric Back With Team Penske as Scott McLaughlin’s Strategist
desc: The longtime Team Penske executive, who parted company with the team last May after penalties incurred at the Indianapolis 500 presented by Gainbridge, will be back on the timing stand this season.
